page.title: 09LOCAL HISTORY.50 YEARS AGO.
page.content: Fifty years ago,in 1935,there were three factories which made children's slippers,but today they are not working. Eyam in the early days had no Village Club,well-dressings or carnival.There was a sheep roast and a Mechanics Institute.Around 1935 there were very few buses that came through the village but there was a railway at Grindleford.In the 1930's there was no television.There was the wireless which needed headphones in order to listen to London. From 1935 to 1985 Eyam has not changed a great deal.Those who have lived in the area all their lives find it a most interesting village.In 1935 the Rose and Crown Public House was a school. This information was provided by Mr.C.Daniels.
